alert.note: Alert for Cheatham (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 12:35AM CST until February 23 at 5:52PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs affecting Cheatham County. For the Harpeth River...including Kingston Springs, Bellevue, Franklin, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Harpeth River Near Kingston Springs. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, The access road to the Narrows of the Harpeth State Park begins to be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 17.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 24.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.3 feet on 02/09/1950. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM CST.
